title: Final 53-man roster projections for every NFL team: What we learned in preseason Week 3
content: The NFL preseason slate is over, and teams have started making moves ahead of final roster cuts on Tuesday.

title: Shedeur, despite struggles, expects roster spot
content: Shedeur Sanders said he is confident he will make the Browns' 53-man roster despite struggling in Saturday's preseason game, adding that he eventually wants to "be a player to be able to change a franchise."

title: Schottenheimer will meet Parsons after lie-down
content: Dallas coach Brian Schottenheimer said Saturday he will meet with Micah Parsons on Sunday to discuss the edge rusher's behavior, after he lay on a medical table behind the Cowboys' bench during Friday's 31-13 preseason victory over the Atlanta Falcons.

title: Cortes silences WS demons, dominates Dodgers
content: The Padres' Nestor Cortes, who gave up the first walk-off grand slam in World Series history in October, faced his Dodgers demons and tossed six brilliant innings in a 5-1 win.

title: 'Unacceptable': Yanks' woes vs. Red Sox continue
content: The Yankees' troublesome struggles against the Red Sox this season continued Saturday in an ugly 12-1 loss at Yankee Stadium.

title: Raiders QB O'Connell breaks wrist, out 6-8 weeks
content: Raiders backup quarterback Aidan O'Connell will need surgery after suffering a fractured right wrist in Saturday's preseason finale and will miss six to eight weeks.

title: Despite tough test, Rebels 'enjoy' Mullen opener
content: Jai'Den Thomas scored three touchdowns, the UNLV defense authored four interceptions, and the heavily favored Rebels held off Idaho State 38-31 on Saturday in the debut of Dan Mullen, an effort the veteran coach and his new club are "going to enjoy."

title: 'Holy grail' MJ-Kobe card sells for record $12.9M
content: A 1-of-1 signed Michael Jordan/Kobe Bryant card broke the record for most expensive sports card sold at auction, closing at $12.932 million Saturday night.

title: üèà Adam Schefter's fantasy football cheat sheet
content: No one is more plugged in to the latest buzz around the NFL than Adam Schefter. We asked him to share his favorite values in fantasy drafts with you.

title: Marching bands! Big entrances! Sing-alongs! 36 of our favorite game-day traditions
content: With a new season here, we look at some of the wild, wacky, wonderful reasons we love college football.

title: Out of the seven new NFL head coaches, who's the most (and least) set up for success?
content: A lot can impact a coach's first season -- but stats can tell a big part of the story, and what could be next.

title: Putting a fair price on every position in college football
content: Max Olson talked to general managers and agents from around the country to put a price tag on each position.

title: Why Delaware felt the pressure to finally jump to FBS
content: As one of two new programs to make the jump to FBS, Delaware is ready to prove itself at a higher level.

title: Rejuvenated Arsenal look the part of title contenders, but depth could be put to test
content: Viktor Gy√∂keres scored his first goals as a Gunner and Max Dowman thrilled on his debut, but issues loom after Arsenal's convincing win over Leeds.

title: Spurs' win at Man City shows transfers aren't everything
content: Losing out to Arsenal for Eberechi Eze was humbling, but Spurs may have already made their best signing.

title: NFL betting guide: Four keys to help you navigate the 2025 season, plus early picks
content: Ben Solak looks at bets to take advantage of -- and ones to avoid -- and offers his strategy and early plays for the 2025 season.

title: Walker tops Zhang at UFC Fight Night in Shanghai
content: Johnny Walker ended a skid of two straight knockout losses by scoring a shocking knockout of his own.

title: Red Sox in must-win mode? Are Yankees back? What you should -- and shouldn't -- believe in the American League
content: How big is this series with New York for Boston? Is Toronto the best team in the AL? We give verdicts on what it all means.

title: How a swing tweak took Roman Anthony to the next level
content: The Red Sox rookie made his Yankee Stadium debut with a bang, but lately, he has been pummeling everybody.

title: üìâ Barnwell picks five NFL teams set to decline
content: Which teams will take a step back and lose more games this season? We made five picks based on troubling signs, offseason subtractions and more.

title: üí∞ Jones: Offer to Parsons was richest for non-QB
content: Jerry Jones said the agreement he believed he made with Micah Parsons would have been the richest ever for a non-quarterback, adding, "Nobody has ever offered him more money than I have to play football. Period."

title: ‚õ≥ Rory: Took home 1,100 Masters flags after win
content: Rory McIlroy said he took all 1,100 pin flags from the Masters Shop after winning at Augusta National in April. "I've waited 17 years to sign that flag in the middle, and I will never complain about doing it."

title: LeBron, KD and an unprecedented next chapter in their 20-year rivalry
content: For two decades, the two superstars have led superteams to NBA glory. Now, for the first time, they're both looking up at one -- and perhaps the best one yet.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Al Ittihad line up bid for Man Utd's Bruno Fernandes
content: Manchester United's Bruno Fernandes is still attracting interest from the Saudi Pro League. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: South Korea Tells China It Wants To Normalise Ties: Reports
content: South Korea is hoping to normalise relations with China that have been strained in recent years, the leader of a high-level delegation from Seoul said during a visit to Beijing on Sunday, Yonhap News Agency reported.

title: "Applies To Me": Rahul Gandhi On Tejashwi Yadav's Marriage Tip For Minister
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi quipped that "talks are on" with RJD president Lalu Prasad, a political ally and family friend, regarding his earlier suggestion that the leader of the opposition in the Lok Sabha should get married

title: Ex-Jharkhand Chief Minister Champai Soren Under House Arrest As Tribals' Protest Against Land Acquisition
content: Former Jharkhand chief minister and BJP leader Champai Soren was placed under house arrest on Sunday to prevent law and order issues in view of a protest by tribal outfits against land acquisition.

title: Law College Rape Filmed Through Hole In Wall For Exhaust Fan: Chargesheet
content: The main accused in the Kolkata law college rape case had made multiple videos of the victim and was blackmailing her with it, says the 650-page chargesheet filed in the case.

title: Video: YouTuber Swept Away While Filming Reels At Duduma Waterfall In Odisha
content: A YouTuber reportedly went missing after he was swept away while filming reels at the Duduma waterfall in Odisha's Koraput district. Hehas been identified as Sagar Tudu (22) of Berhampur in Ganjam district.

title: Frog, Worms In Food Expose Madhya Pradesh's Hunger Crisis
content: First, a dead frog in the hostel food. Then, dal with worms crawling inside in an Anganwadi meal. Within days, two separate food scandals in Shivpuri district have laid bare a chilling truth

title: "Demons Have No Regrets": UP Dowry Victim's Father On Son-In-Law's Remark
content: The father of 28-year-old Nikki Bhati, who died after her husband and in-laws allegedly set her on fire over a Rs 36-lakh dowry demand, has demanded that the accused be shot dead in an encounter and their house be razed as punishment

title: On Ukraine Independence Day, Its Drones Hit Russian Nuclear Plant
content: Russia accused Ukraine Sunday of launching drone attacks that sparked a fire at a nuclear power plant in its western Kursk region overnight, as Ukraine celebrated 34 years since its independence.

title: Woman Accuses Cop Of Misbehaviour On Train, His "I Will Lose Job" Apology
content: A railway police constable has been suspended after a woman passenger alleged that he misbehaved with her while she was asleep on Prayagraj Express.

title: Hyderabad Man Kills Wife, Throws Chopped Off Body Parts In River
content: A man allegedly murdered his wife here and dismembered her body at their home in Medipally near here, police said on Sunday.

title: "He's Only 28": Family Of Indian-Origin Truck Driver Behind US Crash Call For Light Penalty
content: The family and the entire village of Indian-origin trucker Harjinder Singh, who is staring at a potential 45-year jail sentence for allegedly causing a deadly crash in the US, is rallying behind him, calling for a lenient punishment.

title: ISRO Tests Threads That Would Help Bring Astronauts Home From Space
content: The lives of Indian astronauts will literally hang by thread when they return to Earth -indigenously made parachutes will help slow down the craft before its splashdown in the sea.

title: Marijuana Worth Nearly Rs 25 Crore Seized At Delhi Airport
content: Marijuana worth nearly Rs 25 crore has been seized at the international airport here from the possession of a passenger, the customs department said on Sunday.

title: Editors Guild Calls Out Congress For Case Threat To NDTV's Shiv Aroor
content: The Editors Guild of India has expressed concern after senior Congress leader Pawan Khera threatened NDTV Managing Editor Shiv Aroor with a criminal complaint for the August 19 episode of Mr Aroor's popular show, India Matters.

title: "Think Hanuman Ji Was 1st Space Traveller": BJP MP Anurag Thakur To Students
content: It is a fact universally acknowledged that the first person to travel to space was American astronaut Neil Armstrong. However, former Union Minister Anurag Thakur appears to suggest to a group of young students that it was Lord Hanuman.

title: On CCTV, Bengal Teacher Slapped, Punched After He Protests Public Drinking
content: A teacher was assaulted in West Bengal's North 24 Parganas district after he objected to a group of people drinking in public in a residential area. A CCTV camera captured Nirupam Pal's assault. Police have arrested five people.

title: Caught With Fake Disability Certificate, Rajasthan Professor Alleges Computer Error
content: A government college assistant professor in Rajasthan has been accused of securing his post with a fake disability certificate. He now claims the discrepancy was the result of a "computer error".

title: Ladakh Rallies Behind Sonam Wangchuk After Admin Cancels Land Allotment
content: A sudden move by the Ladakh Union Territory administration to cancel the land allotment to Sonam Wangchuk's ambitious Himalayan Institute of Alternative Learning or HIAL has triggered a major controversy.

title: Tamil Nadu govt. asks SEIAA to withdraw clearance for ONGC‚Äôs hydrocarbon project, says Thangam Thennarasu
content: The Minister for Finance, Environment and Climate Change says the government will not allow any  hydrocarbon project in any part of the State ‚Äúeither now or in the future‚Äù.

title: Delay in relief aid dashes hopes of seasonal farmers in Kozhikode hit by monsoon
content: Even as Agriculture department officials claim to have finished field-level assessments and forwarded crop loss estimates, farmers say the proceedings are still moving at a snail‚Äôs pace, leaving them bewildered

title: Collectors review supply of fertilisers, conduct surprise raids
content: Tahsildars and Agriculture Department officials in Krishna district told to identify people hoarding fertilisers and book them under National Security Act, 1980

title: China has agreed in principle to resume trade with India through Shipki-La: Himachal government
content: The State government says Beijing agreed to the proposal during the recent visit of Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi to India. There has also been a positive response regarding resumption of the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra through Shipki-La, it says

title: YSRCP alleges a scam in TTD‚Äôs land swap policy in Tirupati district
content: The party Chittoor district president Bhumana Karunakar Reddy claims the proposed exchange of temple land with APTA benefits the Oberoi Group and demands a public explanation

title: Despite calls for resignation, Mamkootathil stays put as MLA
content: Palakkad legislator says his stature as a frontline defender of the Congress has rendered him a magnet for political enemies¬†

title: Will resist attempts to target Shafi, says Kozhikode DCC
content: The remarks came in the backdrop of a protest staged by pro-Left activists in Vadakara while Mr. Parambil was attending an event

title: Coalition government in Andhra Pradesh lost people‚Äôs trust, says Sajjala Ramakrishna Reddy¬†
content: Counter the government‚Äôs claim that the Super Six schemes are a big hit, he tells party workers and leaders

title: Minister inaugurates Amaravati Championship 2025, vows to revive sports in Andhra Pradesh
content: Around 1,300 athletes compete in 10 categories as Mandipalli announces 30-acre Tirupati sports hub and 450 sports quota posts

title: Scourge of Budameru floods continues to haunt as permanent repair works remain on paper, allege CPI (M) leaders
content: One year after the deluge, the Chief Minister‚Äôs assurances to the flood-hit are confined to rhetoric, they say, adding that the party plans to undertake a week-long campaign from August 30 to highlight the issue

title: ‚ÄòPalleku Podam‚Äô initiative to start this week in Kurnool district
content: District administration appoints 80 special officers to visit villages and solve people‚Äôs problems; visits will be held once every month

title: Three-month-old baby thrown into Budameru rivulet by father in Vijayawada
content: Locals rescue the infant after hearing her cries; accused arrested, child now under Krishna District CWC care

title: Safe to Eat project: PRRAL rejigs methodology for reporting pesticide residue levels in vegetable, fruit samples
content: With PRRAL adopting FSSAI‚Äôs crop-wise MRL methodology, the immediate visible change is in the percentage of samples with pesticide residues above the permissible levels. Pesticide residues were found in just 1.53% of the samples tested in 67th report, a sharp drop from 21.29% in 66th report and 15.26% in 65th report.

title: Punjab Minister seeks Centre's intervention after U.S. pauses visas for foreign truck drivers
content: While we fully acknowledge the seriousness of this incident and the need for justice, the subsequent broad policy of pausing visas is causing immense distress among the estimated 1.50 lakh Punjabis working in the U.S. trucking industry, says Punjab Industry Minister Sanjeev Arora

title: Police in Chittoor, Annamayya, and Sri Sathya Sai districts intensify security measures ahead of Vinayaka Chavithi celebrations
content: Superintendents of Police review preparedness, stress technology-led monitoring, and advise organisers on safety and clearance protocols

title: VACB slaps criminal enquiries against 40 MVD officials in Kerala on charges of corruption
content: VACB recommends disciplinary action against 112 officials.¬†Action unfolds against the backdrop of its operation ‚ÄúClean Wheels,‚Äù targeting corruption in 81 MVD offices across the State¬†

title: Five Nagaland tribes decline invitation to Governor‚Äôs swearing-in
content: These tribes, considered advanced, are demanding a review of the State‚Äôs reservation policy for 10 other tribes

title: Mangaluru‚Äôs Kasturba Medical College develops new application to distinguish menstrual and non-menstrual bloodstains in crime scene
content: According to the research team, the new technique analyses the unique, surface-specific characteristics of stains, enabling experts to confirm whether blood found on clothing, bedding, or other materials in a crime scene is menstrual or non-menstrual.

title: Dharmasthala case: YouTuber M.D. Sameer appears before Belthangady police
content: The Belthangady police had issued two notices asking Mr. Sameer to appear before the investigation officer in connection with a suo-motu case registered against him following a 23-minute video, on the alleged mass burial matter, posted on his YouTube channel Dhoota.

title: Kerala MLA Rahul Mamkootathil gives no definitive answer concerning calls for his resignation on grounds of sexual misconduct
content: Mamkootathil says he did not desire to push the Congress into a political purgatory and the party workers ‚Äúshould not hang their heads in shame‚Äù because of him

title: Alappuzha District Development Committee directs speedy completion of Punargeham flats
content: Punargeham project of Kerala government aims to rehabilitate fisher families living within 50 metres of the coastline

title: Meet Anasuya, the woman managing a Shivamogga crematorium for over 25 years
content: At the Rotary Crematorium in Shivamogga‚Äôs Vidya Nagara, Anasuya takes documents, arranges fuel for the pyre, assists family members in conducting the rituals and ensures that the families get the ashes later.

title: Bills disqualifying PM, CMs aimed at Opposition, creating revolt in regional parties: Akhilesh Yadav
content: Referring to the Bills introduced in the Lok Sabha to disqualify the Prime Minister, Chief Ministers, or Ministers placed under arrest for 30 consecutive days on serious charges, Akhilesh Yadav said the move was politically motivated

title: Kerala students develop solar-powered robot to clean waterbodies
content: Students of IHRD College of Engineering, Chengannur, built robot capable of collecting floating waste from water sources. Primary objective of the initiative is to eliminate surface pollutants from waterbodies, thereby protecting and preserving the environment

title: Woman dies after falling from Bengaluru flyover in road accident, husband injured
content: Around 12.30 a.m., while the couple was riding near the Bachahalli Gate flyover, a speeding car coming from the wrong side hit their scooter in a head-on collision.

title: ISRO completes first integrated air drop test for Gaganyaan
content: The ascent, descent, and post-splashdown phases of the Gaganyaan mission are expected to be the most risky for astronauts

title: Six vehicles torched by Maoists in Jharkhand's Hazaribag
content: Nine to 10 people carried out the incident by torching six vehicles, including three earthmovers. A leaflet of the TPC was found at a distance from the site, says Bishnugarh SDPO

title: Himachal Pradesh: 298 people dead since onset of monsoon, says SDMA
content: According to a report by SDMA, of the 298 deaths, 152 were rain-related, caused by landslips, flash floods, house collapses and other weather-triggered incidents; 146 fatalities were in road accidents, many linked to slippery conditions and damaged roads

title: Detangling the knots of e-governance for Karnataka citizens, one click at a time
content: Zen Citizen offers guides that cover the entire journey of applying for government services, explaining how to plan ahead, prepare the required documents and handle issues after the application is submitted

title: Not good if House not allowed to run session after session for narrow political gains, says Amit Shah
content: The Home Minister also said that when there is limited debate or discussions in Parliament, the contribution of the House in nation-building gets affected

title: Government urged to conduct socioeconomic survey to understand pathetic condition of folk artistes
content: Badri Kurma Rao said that over 5000 artistes were facing financial hurdles in the absence of income sources and pensions

title: Aadhaar alone cannot get one enrolled as voter, says BJP
content: The Aadhaar Act, he added, says it is only proof of identity and residence, and does not establish citizenship

title: BJP warns Pinarayi and Stalin against attending ‚ÄòGlobal Ayyappa Sangamam‚Äô at Sabarimala without ‚Äòapologising to Hindus‚Äô
content: In a social media post on X on August 24, 2025, Mr Chandrasekhar accused both Chief Ministers of ‚Äúinsulting‚Äù the Hindu faith

title: Noida dowry murder: Mother-in-law arrested, husband shot in leg¬†by Uttar Pradesh Police while trying to flee custody
content: Vipin Bhati was arrested on Saturday (August 23, 2025) after he was caught on video allegedly assaulting Nikki, his wife

title: Psychology, nutrition, healthcare courses can't be offered in distance learning, online mode: UGC
content: The ban applies to courses under the National Commission for Allied and Healthcare Professions (NCAHP) Act, 2021; these include psychology, microbiology, food and nutrition science, biotechnology, clinical nutrition and dietetics

title: INDIA bloc constituents in Bihar working unitedly, poll results will be fruitful: Rahul Gandhi
content: INDIA bloc will soon come out with a common manifesto for the Bihar Assembly elections, Rahul Gandhi said

title: Former Jharkhand CM Champai Soren under house arrest in view of tribals‚Äô protests over land acquisition
content: Champai Soren‚Äôs son Babulal Soren, along with supporters who were on way to Ranchi, have also been detained at a police station, police said

title: Congress MLA Rahul Mamkootathil finds himself isolated as party leadership thinks about his resignation
content: The call for his resignation as Palakkad legislator seemed to gain momentum on Sunday (August 24, 2025), with senior leaders, chiefly Ramesh Chennithala, reportedly signalling to the national leadership that Mr. Mamkootathil‚Äôs continuation as MLA may not bode well for the Congress party in Kerala

title: To become a good leader, one should first become a good human being: Sridhar Aranala
content: Mr. Aranala was addressing the students on the subject of ‚ÄúLeadership and career growth: Managing people, pressure and headlines‚Äù

title: Maharashtra to register women cooperative, give government contracts: CM Fadnavis
content: The Chief Minister clarified that none of the welfare schemes announced before the 2024 State Assembly elections would be discontinued for the next five years

title: BJP worker arrested for beating Scheduled Caste engineer with shoe in U.P.‚Äôs Ballia
content: BJP District president Sanjay Mishra confirmed that Munna Bahadur is a party worker and the Superintendent of Police¬†said Bahadur and others with him were booked

title: Gaganyaan mission symbol of new chapter in journey of Atmanirbhar Bharat, says Rajnath Singh
content: At an event hosted by the IAF at Subroto Park in New Delhi, the Defence Minister felicitated the four Gaganyatris.

title: Bus catches fire on Mumbai-Goa highway, narrow escape for 44 passengers
content: Before the Kashedi tunnel, a tyre burst and it caught fire, following which the bus driver applied emergency brakes and asked all the passengers to get down, the official said

title: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu calls upon the TDP leaders to thwart the YSRCP‚Äôs false propaganda¬†
content: TDP should thwart YSRCP‚Äôs mischievous campaign that the capital Amaravati was flooded during the recent spell of heavy rains, and the gates of Prakasam barrage have collapsed

title: BSF apprehends 15 Pakistani fishermen near border in Gujarat's Kutch
content: The BSF carried out a search operation on Saturday (August 23) on the basis of a specific information regarding an unidentified boat found in the general area of the border outpost

title: Maharashtra Minister asks Jarange to hold talks with Govt ahead of protests
content: Jarange called for a protest at Azad Maidan in south Mumbai from August 29, demanding reservation for the Maratha community under the Other Backward Classes (OBC) category

title: Flash floods in Himachal Pradesh threaten trout fish
content: The department of Fisheries has urged the State Government to include trout farmers under the disaster relief manual

title: DRDO successfully conducts maiden flight tests of Integrated Air Defence Weapon System
content: ‚ÄúThis unique flight test has established the multi-layered air-defence capability of our country and is going to strengthen area defence for important facilities against enemy aerial threats,‚Äù says Rajnath Singh

title: In Frames: Long-playing vintage tuning hands
content: R. Sundaravadanan, fondly known as Stylus Mani, repairs and refurbishes styluses and turntables at his home workshop in Thiruvananthapuram, keeping the music of the past alive

title: Kalaignar Magalir Urimai Thogai scheme in Tamil Nadu: crediting care work by women heads of families
content: While the disparity in payment for male and female workers remains as stark as ever, the Tamil Nadu government‚Äôs Kalaignar Magalir Urimai Thogai scheme recognises the unpaid labour, giving many women dignity, self-respect, and financial independence. Meghna M. does a SWOT analysis to see what works and what needs to be done better

title: Bail out distressed tenant farmers, former bureaucrat writes to A.P. govt.
content: State government should take up a study involving experts, analyse the reasons for farmer suicides and formulate pro-farmer policies within two months, he says

title: AAP MP Ashok Mittal calls for boycott of U.S. soft drink companies at LPU over tariff hike
content: Lovely Professional University in Punjab to ban U.S. companies‚Äô soft drinks if tariffs on Indian goods comes into effect

title: Indian-origin truck driver facing homicide charges in U.S. denied bond
content: Harjinder Singh was charged with three state counts of vehicular homicide and immigration violations, and he was denied bond on all charges

title: ‚ÄòNo bag day‚Äô is to encourage students to be creative‚Äô¬†¬†
content: Observed every fourth Saturday, no-bag day or bagless day, as per National Education Policy 2020, is for enrichment of students with activities including vocational crafts, or a visit to a place of importance

title: Greater Noida woman killed for ‚Çπ36 lakh dowry, husband held
content: A woman was¬†assaulted and set on fire by her husband and in-laws in Greater Noida over a dowry; a case was registered against the victim‚Äôs husband and his family at Kasna Police Station

title: Nearly 1.5 lakh benefited from ‚ÄòNalam Kaakkum Stalin‚Äô camps in three weeks, says CM
content: Stalin highlighted the response to the Nalam Kaakkum Stalin camps, which have been conducted across the State every Saturday since August 2

title: 1.48 lakh cases of traffic violation settled, ‚Çπ4.18 cr. collected on day 1
content: The government had announced a one-time 50% concession on penalties for pending cases recorded through the Police Department‚Äôs mobile e-challan system

title: India in position to help lift the world out of slow growth: PM Modi
content: The Prime Minister outlines India‚Äôs economic growth, reforms, and self-reliance goals to lift global growth

title: IISc team finds ancient proteins that hint at life‚Äôs leap in complexity
content: A pair of unusual proteins in archaea have revealed how cells first experimented with the structures that shape higher life

title: Tobacco control laws are out of step with smokeless tobacco
content: Achieving the tobacco endgame in India requires a coordinated strategy across multiple ministries, alongside stringent implementation of existing laws, increased taxes, and stronger research bodies

title: Dowry killing: 'Why did you leave me?' - husband faked grief in online post hours before arrest
content: Vipin, accused of murdering his wife Nikki for dowry, posted an Instagram story framing her death as suicide hours before his arrest. Nikki's sister alleges constant dowry demands and torture, culminating in Vipin setting Nikki ablaze in front of her child. Police have arrested Vipin and are searching for his family members involved in the crime.

title: Watch: Israel strikes Yemen's missile bases; explosions near presidential complex
content: Loud explosions rocked Sanaa, Yemen's capital, on Sunday afternoon following reported Israeli airstrikes. A security source confirmed Israel's involvement, stating they carried out a strike in Sanaa. Residents reported the strikes targeted areas near the presidential complex and missile bases, with similar attacks reported in the port city of Hodeidah.

title: Hyderabad horror: Man kills pregnant wife, chops her up; throws body parts in river
content: In a gruesome incident in Hyderabad, a 27-year-old man allegedly murdered his five-month pregnant wife following frequent disputes. He dismembered her body and disposed of the parts in the Musi river to conceal the crime.

title: Watch: Man climbs tower in 'Sholay' style for girlfriend - then a big twist
content: Inspired by "Sholay," Pawan Pandey climbed a mobile tower in Bhadohi, demanding his 'girlfriend' Khushbu be brought for marriage. The five-hour standoff ended when police impersonated Khushbu over the phone. Investigations revealed Pandey was a victim of online fraud, communicating with a fake Instagram profile for two years, leading to a case of public disturbance and ongoing fraud investigation.

title: AI and jobs: Microsoft AI CEO to workers; My central worry is many will be left behind
content: Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman cautions that AI's rapid advancement may outpace people's ability to adapt, leading to a significant skill gap rather than widespread job losses. He urges governments, companies, and educators to prioritize reskilling programs and digital literacy.

title: No farewell! Pujara retires; joins list of legends without a goodbye game
content: Cheteshwar Pujara's quiet retirement highlights a common trend in cricket, where legends like MS Dhoni and Virender Sehwag also missed grand farewells. Many Indian cricket stars, including Yuvraj Singh and Zaheer Khan, exited without fanfare due to form, injuries, or team decisions. The future of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma remains uncertain, raising concerns about potential unceremonious departures.

title: Greater Noida dowry death: Victim's mother-in-law held; father demands death penalty
content: In the Greater Noida dowry death case, police have arrested the victim's mother-in-law after her husband, Vipin Bhati, was apprehended following an attempted escape. Nikki Bhati died from severe burn injuries, with her family alleging dowry-related torture by her husband and in-laws. The main accused, Vipin Bhati, denies responsibility, while investigations are ongoing.

title: Tesla investors to Nasdaq: Elon Musk‚Äôs $29 billion stock award faces fresh scrutiny
content: SOC Investment Group has formally requested Nasdaq to investigate Tesla's recent $29 billion equity grant to Elon Musk. The shareholder group alleges that the Tesla board bypassed Nasdaq‚Äôs rules by not putting the "2025 CEO Interim Award" to a shareholder vote.

title: 'Just bad luck': Kin of trucker in Florida crash urge mercy; say 'don't ruin his life'
content: Harjinder Singh, an Indian-origin truck driver, faces vehicular homicide charges in Florida after a fatal crash that killed three. His family pleads for leniency, while a petition supporting him gains traction. The case has sparked political debate, with concerns raised about potential discrimination against Punjabi truckers and visa restrictions.

title: 'Talks are on': Rahul Gandhi recalls Lalu Prasad‚Äôs marriage advice
content: Rahul Gandhi playfully responded to suggestions about his marriage during a press conference in Araria. He mentioned that he's in talks with Lalu Prasad Yadav, referencing an earlier suggestion from the RJD leader to get married. This came after Tejashwi Yadav humorously advised Union Minister Chirag Paswan to also consider marriage, sparking Gandhi's light-hearted remark.

title: SpaceX loses its youngest engineer: Kairan Quazi leaves Starlink team
content: Kairan Quazi, the 16-year-old prodigy who previously worked at SpaceX, is now joining Citadel Securities as a developer in New York City. He chose the quantitative trading firm over AI labs and big tech companies, drawn to the fast-paced environment and intellectual challenges it offers. Quazi will be working on global trading infrastructure, embracing Wall Street's meritocratic culture.

title: Kolkata gang-rape case: Chargesheet filed against 4; Manojit's role confirmed
content: Kolkata police submitted a charge sheet against four individuals in the law college gang-rape case. The survivor reported the crime occurred on June 25. The charge sheet names Manojit Mishra, Pramit Mukhopadhyay, Zaib Ahmed, and Pinaki Banerjee. Accusations include gang rape, wrongful confinement, and issuing death threats. DNA evidence links Mishra to the crime.

title: 'I have no remorse': Greater Noida dowry killing accused; makes shocking remarks
content: Vipin Bhati, the main accused in the Greater Noida dowry murder case, denies responsibility for his wife Nikki's death. He claims she died on her own and feels no remorse. Nikki's family alleges Bhati and his parents repeatedly tortured her for dowry. They staged a protest demanding justice.

title: Jerry Jones Blocks Micah Parsons Exit: Bold Stand Shakes Dallas Cowboys ‚Äî Trade Drama Unfold
content: Despite a contract dispute and trade request from Micah Parsons, former NFL GM Doug Whaley believes the star pass rusher will remain with the Dallas Cowboys. Whaley points to past situations with Myles Garrett and T.J. Watt, where money ultimately resolved similar issues.

title: Hyderabad‚ÄìTirupati flight cancelled: Hit by repeated glitches - what Alliance Air said
content: Alliance Air cancelled its Hyderabad-Tirupati flight on Sunday from Rajiv Gandhi International Airport due to recurring technical issues with the aircraft. Initially, the flight returned for engineering checks after a glitch but was cleared. However, another snag requiring extended repairs led to the cancellation to prevent further disruptions to the airline's schedule.

title: Sourav Ganguly‚Äôs first-ever coaching stint; former India skipper joins Pretoria Capitals
content: Sourav Ganguly, the former Indian captain, has been appointed as the head coach of the Pretoria Capitals, an SA20 franchise, for the 2026 season. This marks Ganguly's inaugural coaching role with a cricket team. The Centurion-based team confirmed the appointment following Jonathan Trott's departure, hoping Ganguly's leadership will bring a turnaround in their performance.

title: Top 5 entertainment news
content: Sunny Deol praised Aryan Khan's directorial debut, while Tina Ahuja addressed her parents' divorce rumors. Faissal Khan is set to direct a multi-starrer film after distancing himself from Aamir Khan. Neha Dhupia recalled backlash over pregnancy before marriage. A video of Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt‚Äôs luxurious bungalow went viral as they plan to move in soon.

title: PM Modi invites Zelenskyy to India; date to be finalised soon
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has invited Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy to visit India, according to Ukraine's Ambassador Oleksandr Polishchuk. While the date is yet to be finalised, both the sides are actively working towards it. Polishchuk also praised India's support for peace and diplomacy in the ongoing conflict with Russia.

title: Cheteshwar Pujara retires: 21,301 runs, 66 hundreds and an unmatched domestic legacy
content: Cheteshwar Pujara, India's dependable Test batsman, has retired from all cricket forms, concluding a career marked by remarkable patience and prolific run-scoring. With 7,195 Test runs and an astounding 21,301 first-class runs, including 66 centuries, he ranks among India's cricketing giants. Pujara's contribution to Saurashtra's domestic success is unparalleled, leading them to two Ranji Trophy titles.

title: Patrick Mahomes‚Äô mom Randi: Chiefs games become runways; her fierce looks go viral
content: Randi Mahomes, mother of NFL star Patrick Mahomes, is making waves this season with her vibrant game-day fashion. Partnering with Gameday Couture, she's empowering Kansas City Chiefs fans to showcase bold, chic style while supporting their team. Randi's Instagram teases sequined vests and Chiefs-themed ensembles, inspiring fans to embrace team pride with flair.

title: AUS vs SA | Historic rout! Australia hand South Africa their heaviest ODI defeat ever
content: Australia delivered a commanding performance, defeating South Africa by 276 runs in Mackay, marking the Proteas' heaviest ODI loss. Travis Head (142) and Mitchell Marsh (100) set the stage with a record-breaking opening partnership, followed by Cameron Green's explosive unbeaten 118. South Africa struggled to respond, collapsing for 155 as Cooper Connolly claimed 5-22.

title: 'Satta chori': Kharge's latest jab at Centre; targets BJP's 'remove ministers' bills
content: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge has accused the BJP of attempting to steal power through new bills designed to topple opposition governments quickly. He alleges these bills empower agencies like the ED and CBI, undermining citizens' rights and democratic processes. Kharge also highlighted concerns about alleged vote manipulation and the misuse of voter list revisions to suppress opposition support, urging vigilance among party workers.

title: Greater Noida dowry murder: Accused shot in leg while fleeing police custody
content: Vipin, the main suspect in the Greater Noida dowry murder case, was injured while attempting to escape police custody after being arrested for allegedly torturing and setting his wife, Nikki, on fire. Nikki, married to Vipin in 2016, endured years of dowry-related abuse, culminating in her death.

title: Last time Pujara played for India: Who were his teammates and where are they?
content: Cheteshwar Pujara, known for his resilience, has retired from Indian cricket after 103 Tests, his last being the 2023 World Test Championship final. That match also marked the end for some teammates. Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli retired from T20Is and Tests, while Shubman Gill now captains the Test side.

title: Fraud bust: Syrian man posed as Gaza victim to dupe mosques; lived lavish lifestyle
content: A Syrian national, Ali Meghat Al-Azhar, was apprehended in Ahmedabad for allegedly deceiving mosques into donating money under the guise of aiding Gaza war victims. Authorities suspect the funds were used for a lavish lifestyle. Police are searching for Al-Azhar's three accomplices and investigating potential threats to national security.

title: RIMS-2 land row: Ex-CM Soren detained ahead of protest; 'dictatorship', slams BJP
content: Former Jharkhand CM Champai Soren was placed under house arrest on Sunday, preventing him from joining a protest against the state government's land acquisition for RIMS-2. Police cited maintaining law and order as the reason. BJP leaders criticized the move as dictatorial, with Union Minister Sanjay Seth calling it a black mark on democracy.

title: Dharmasthala mass burial row: 'Habitual liar' faked it for money, says ex-wife
content: C N Chinnayya, arrested for Dharmasthala mass burial claims, faces accusations from his divorced wife, Rathnamma, who alleges he's a habitual liar seeking financial gain. She claims he never mentioned such incidents during their marriage and lied in court to avoid alimony. Villagers corroborate his history of deceit and multiple failed marriages, questioning the validity of his claims.

title: Gisele B√ºndchen vs Jack Brady: Accused of ‚Äòerasing‚Äô Tom's son; shifts focus to new family
content: Tom Brady celebrated his son Jack's 18th birthday. He shared photos and heartfelt messages. Gisele Bundchen, Brady's ex-wife, did not post a public message. She shared photos of her younger children. This difference sparked online discussion. It highlights how blended families manage milestones. Social media silence doesn't always indicate a problem. It can be a choice to protect privacy.

title: 'Should get married': Tejashwi advises Chirag; Rahul responds in jest
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav mocked Chirag Paswan's loyalty to PM Modi, declaring himself a 'Hanuman of the public'. He also playfully advised Paswan to marry soon, a sentiment echoed by Rahul Gandhi. Gandhi, sharing the stage with Yadav, accused the Election Commission of bias towards the BJP in Bihar, alleging vote theft through manipulated electoral rolls.

title: Gaganyaan: Isro completes key first integrated drop test
content: ISRO successfully conducted the first integrated air-drop test (IADT-01) at Sriharikota, validating the parachute system for the Gaganyaan mission's crew module recovery. The test, involving multiple parachutes, aimed to ensure safe deceleration and splashdown. Following earlier helicopter-related concerns, the successful IADT-01 paves the way for future tests and uncrewed Gaganyaan missions.

title: Bruised but not broken! When Pujara was hit 11 times by Australia ‚Äî and stood tall
content: Cheteshwar Pujara, after announcing his retirement, is remembered for his resilience, exemplified by his courageous innings at the Gabba in 2021. He endured 11 blows to his body from Australian pacers, including Cummins, Starc and Hazlewood, prioritizing his wicket to blunt the attack and pave the way for India's historic victory.

title: Pujara retires: Gavaskar leads tributes ‚Äî 'You have made India proud'
content: Cheteshwar Pujara, the embodiment of Test cricket resilience, has retired from all Indian cricket forms after a distinguished career. Sunil Gavaskar praised Pujara's dedication and selflessness, highlighting his commitment to Indian cricket above all else. Pujara, known for his grit and patience, scored 7,195 runs in 103 Tests, leaving a legacy of unwavering determination and service to the team.

title: Watch: 15-year-old student dies of cardiac arrest while playing basketball
content: In a tragic incident, fifteen-year-old Manveer Singh, a Class IX student, died of a sudden cardiac arrest while playing basketball at his school in Gidderbaha. The seemingly healthy boy collapsed on the playground during a game with classmates and was declared dead at the hospital.

title: Pujara retires! From 206 vs England to gritty 56 at Gabba - his top 5 greatest knocks
content: Cheteshwar Pujara, India's dependable Test batter, has retired from international cricket after a 103-Test career, amassing 7,195 runs. Celebrated for his resilience and patience, Pujara's memorable innings include a double century against England in 2012 and a gritty 202 against Australia in 2017. His contributions, defined by mental toughness and commitment, have left an indelible mark on Indian cricket.

title: Watch: Man, triyng to approach Rahul during Bihar yatra, slapped by security
content: During Rahul Gandhi's "Vote Adhikar Yatra" in Bihar, a man breached security and approached him for a hug while he was on a motorcycle in Araria. Security intervened, resulting in the man being slapped and causing a brief disruption. The 1,300-km yatra, launched on August 17, will traverse over 20 districts, culminating in a Patna rally on September 1.

title: 'Slapped my mother, set her on fire': Son‚Äôs shocking account in Greater Noida ‚Äòdowry‚Äô death
content: In Greater Noida, a six-year-old witnessed his mother's horrific murder by his father and grandparents, who doused her in liquid, slapped her, and set her ablaze due to dowry demands. Nikki succumbed to her injuries in a Delhi hospital. Her husband has been arrested, while the other family members are on the run, facing charges of murder and conspiracy.

title: ‚ÄòWith you every step of the way‚Äô: Canadian PM arrives in Ukraine for independence day
content: Mark Carney, as a special guest, arrived in Kyiv for Ukraine's Independence Day, reaffirming Canada's unwavering support. He pledged solidarity and discussed potential security guarantees, following Canada's commitment of $2 billion in defence aid. Carney's tour includes Poland, Germany, and Latvia, focusing on resolving the Russia-Ukraine conflict, with Canada potentially playing a key role in a broader support coalition.

title: Gurgaon: She met him on Instagram and got married; 8 months later, he killed her
content: In Gurgaon, a 34-year-old woman from Uttarakhand was allegedly murdered by her 26-year-old husband, whom she met on Instagram and married last December. Police arrested the husband, who confessed to the crime. Frequent arguments plagued their relationship.

title: Cheteshwar Pujara retires: From Gautam Gambhir to R Ashwin - who said what?
content: Anil Kumble and other prominent cricket figures lauded Cheteshwar Pujara as he retired from all formats of Indian cricket. Pujara concluded his career after 103 Tests, amassing 7,195 runs. Celebrated for his grit and patience, Pujara's contributions were widely acknowledged by teammates and rivals alike, who wished him well for his future endeavors.

title: ‚ÄòApologise with folded hands or ... ‚Äô: Gujarat student receives death threats
content: Following the tragic death of Nayan Santani, another incident of student conflict has emerged in Ahmedabad. A Class 12 student at IP Mission School in Raikhad reported receiving threatening messages on social media from an expelled peer. The conflict stemmed from a classroom altercation where a student accidentally hit a female classmate with a door.

title: Premier League updates: Everton host Brighton at new stadium
content: Welcome to ESPN's coverage of Sunday's  Premier League  action! Later on Sunday,  Fulham  host  Manchester United , who hope the new-look attacking trio of  Bryan Mbeumo ,  Matheus Cunha  and  Benjamin Sesko  can deliver a first win. But first  Everton  host  Brighton  in the first league fixture at their new Hill Dickinson Stadium, and  Crystal Palace  take on  Nottingham Forest  in a game with added spice because Forest took Palace's  Europa League  place after the Eagles were demoted for breaking multiclub ownership rules. Join us for all the highlights and big moments from Sunday's action.

title: US Open odds: Sinner favored on men's side, Swiatek top choice on women's side
content: The defending US Open champions on the men's and women's sides are at or near the top of the odds for the tournament's 145th edition in their quests to repeat. Jannik Sinner , who won the Wimbledon men's singles championship last month, is +105 to claim his second US Open title in a row.  Carlos Alcaraz , his opponent in the Wimbledon final, is the second choice at +180. On the women's side,  Iga Swiatek  (+250), this year's Wimbledon champ and the 2022 US Open winner, is a slight favorite over defending champion  Aryna Sabalenka  (+270) in the final Grand Slam of the year. Singles play runs Sunday through Sept. 7, with ESPN providing coverage of the event on its networks. The women's final will be played Saturday, Sept. 6 at  4 p.m. ET on ESPN , and the men's final takes place the following day at 2 p.m. ET on ABC. Every tournament match will stream live on the ESPN App.
